name: Smylex
description: A deadly chemical weapon devised by The Joker in "Batman (1989)", causing victims to die with a grin on their faces.

content.title: Overview
content.body: **Smylex** is a toxic chemical weapon invented by The Joker in Tim Burton's "Batman" (1989). This sinister product is part of the Joker's scheme to terrorize Gotham City by causing untimely deaths of its citizens, leaving them with grotesque smiles.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: Smylex is typically packaged in consumer products such as cosmetics, hygiene items, and food products, making it difficult to detect before use. Consumers unsuspectingly exposed to these everyday items containing Smylex suffer its lethal effects.

content.title: Function
content.body: When ingested or used, Smylex attacks the respiratory system, resulting in almost instant death. The victims are left with a characteristic 'Joker grin,' which is a wide, rigid smile, reminiscent of The Joker's own facial expression.

content.title: History
content.body: Smylex was created by The Joker (played by Jack Nicholson) as part of his plan to unleash chaos in Gotham City. Using Axis Chemicals as his base of operations, he developed the toxin to incorporate into everyday products, ensuring widespread distribution.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: Smylex is central to The Joker's plot and causes widespread panic across Gotham City. A significant scene involves the Joker announcing the contamination of products via television, taunting citizens who attempt to use the affected items. The threat of Smylex forces Batman to act swiftly, seeking to neutralize the Joker and his deadly weapon.
